message: What is this thing?
yo
just stumbled across this and i'm always on the lookout for collab tools that can help over long distances. this seems, um, weird. in a google wave sort of way.
/me waves
at least it doesn't show things as i type
while the multi-topic with storage of old messages thing seems possibly interesting compared to IRC, methinks it's not interesting enough
actually, I amend what I said 8 hours ago... I think it's probably better than IRC, but getting people to change can be hard.
from a professional perspective i like that convore is on the web
from a personal workflow perspective i like that irc is in a different application.
adium stores chat log archives, so that's not an issue for me
irc has poor discovery of 'new stuff' (like it has none). i don't know if this has anything beyond 'mentions' but that's more than irc has (assuming it's global)
i think i like irc more :)
this doesn't seem to have compeling features when compared to irc, hehe
yeah, I don't see us replacing IRC with this
it's like a chat-based version of quora
adium stores irc archives only when you're online.
i'm actually rather impressed at how well convore survived its flood of new traffic yesterday

Just want to doublecheck something. If I want to type in multiple paragraphs here, is it going to submit when I press enter?

Shift enter works fine for adding more.
@dangoor do direct replies show up in the public list?
@robcee I think so, but they get called out in the "mentions" tab, which I think is the value there
I thought of another criticism (well, three) of this service: What guarantee do we have that it will continue to exist? What about privacy? Who owns this thing?

none, for the first question. for the second: this particular group is public. for the third, there's an about page. (intriguingly, I just learned that you can link directly to an image and Convore will try to include that image in the stream)
http://icanhascheezburger.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/e8c91bf9-1178-4f1e-8b1f-d0494d4d0cc5.jpg
byeeeeeeeeeeeee
well, this'll do as well as anywhere for a test word-splurge :)
